news.title: Fourth-quarter U.S. GDP up just 1.4%, badly missing estimate
news.summary: The core PCE price index was expected to increase 3% from a year ago in December. GDP was projected to rise at a 2.5% pace in Q4.

news.title: Trump could attack Iran in days — what's at stake for the oil market
news.summary: President Trump has warned Iran that an attack would be "far worse" than the U.S. airstrikes that targeted its nuclear facilities last June.

news.title: Privacy is at the center of child safety accusations against Apple and Meta. Here’s why
news.summary: Privacy and encryption are central themes in legal proceedings involving child safety. Meta and Apple are being sued by the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.

news.title: Bath & Body Works starts selling on Amazon as more brands embrace its logistics network
news.summary: Bath & Body Works CEO Daniel Heaf told CNBC the Amazon launch is about meeting customers where they are and leveraging Amazon's fast and free shipping.

news.title: 'Canary in the coal mine': Blue Owl liquidity curbs fuel fears about private credit bubble
news.summary: Blue Owl Capital permanently restricted withdrawals from one of its retail-focused debt funds. The private credit boom is facing a new test after Blue Owl Capital restricted withdrawals.

news.title: Opendoor’s stock rallies as the home buyer shows progress in pivot to leaner business model
news.summary: The home buyer said it’s making progress on becoming a less-capital intensive, more profitable business. The company said it's making progress in becoming less capital intensive and more profitable.

news.title: GDP grew 2.2% in 2025. The economy might do even better this year.
news.summary: The U.S. expanded at a subpar 1.4% annual pace in the fourth quarter of 2025. The record 43-day federal shutdown caused a big decline in government spending.

news.title: Gold’s push back above $5,000 is picking up steam, but it’s been a bumpy week
news.summary: Gold prices are attempting to cement a recovery above the $5,000 level. Gold prices have been in a downward trend since the beginning of the year.

news.title: The economy just flashed a Goldilocks signal — and it’s been doing a lot of that lately
news.summary: The tone of U.S. economic data has a Goldilocks feel, a strategist says. The tone of the data has been more positive than negative, he says.

news.title: The Fed’s favorite inflation tool shows it has more work to do to ratchet down price increases
news.summary: The Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge showed prices rose close to 3% in 2025. The central bank more work to do to get cost-of-living increases back down to pre-pandemic lows.
